title.narrative: Improving vaccination coverage and health services for children under five years of age in selected districts of Pakistan

description.narrative: Contribute to saving the lives of millions of Pakistani children living in the targeted areas by vaccinating children against 11 diseases (tuberculosis, smallpox, polio, diphtheria, whooping cough, tetanus, measles, rotavirus, pneumococcus, hepatitis, meningitis and typhoid)

This project will contribute to saving the lives of hundreds of thousands and even millions of Pakistani children. By protecting children from serious diseases, vaccines play a pivotal role in ending preventable child deaths. The immunization program carried out by the King Salman Center for Relief and Humanitarian Action, in cooperation with UNICEF, helps identify children who have left the health system, in addition to the possibility of providing life-saving care to mothers and children.
Vaccination of children under five years of age in the provinces of Balochistan, Khyber, Pakhtunkhwa and Punjab in the Republic of Pakistan with the basic vaccines needed to immunize children
